title: Implement new bead modal dialog design
description:
Implement a new content-first modal design for viewing and editing bead details, based on Design System 3.0 specifications.

Design Reference: [Screenshot provided showing Content-First Task Modal]

Component: plugins/beads-bridge/skills/beads-bridge/src/client/src/components/DetailModal.tsx

Key Design Features:
1. Content-first layout optimized for reading and editing long descriptions
2. Metadata de-emphasized to reduce noise
3. Dynamic border theme based on status (Slate-300 for To Do, Blue-300 for In Progress, Green-300 for Completed)
4. Fixed width container (max-w-2xl) with backdrop blur overlay

Implementation Specifications:

**1. Container & Structure:**
- Dynamic 1px border that changes color based on status
- Fixed width container, centered with backdrop blur overlay
- Status-themed borders: To Do (Slate-300), In Progress (Blue-300), Completed (Green-300)

**2. Header Interactions (Top Bar Controls):**
- Task ID: Displayed in font-mono with hover-to-copy functionality
- Timestamp: Show "Last Updated" next to ID in small, muted text (Slate-300)
- Status Pill: Pill-styled status matching Status Theme colors (Blue text on Blue bg for In Progress)
- Custom ChevronDown icon for status dropdown

**3. Typography & Editing (Seamless Text Input):**
- Title Field: Auto-resizing textarea with text-2xl, Bold styling
- Background is slate-50 to denote field but blends cleanly
- Description: Large scrollable area with default styling bg-slate-50/50
- On focus, background turns white and gains ring to signal active editing mode

**4. Footer Metadata (Read-Only Context):**
- Priority: Display Flag icon + Value (P1/P2)
- Type: Display Layout icon + Value (Task/Bug)
- Subtasks: Display CheckSquare icon + Total count only (e.g. "4 Subtasks")
- Status of subtasks is hidden in this view

title: Bug: Create subtask assigns wrong parent
description: When clicking '+ Create subtask' on wms-yun.2, the newly created subtask incorrectly becomes a child of wms-yun.3 instead of wms-yun.2. The parent ID is being passed incorrectly somewhere in the frontend state management or event handling. Found during testing of wms-yun.4 fix.

comments.author: mrdavidlaing
comments.text:
ROOT CAUSE FOUND: The bug is NOT in beads-bridge code. The dependencies are created correctly in the database (verified via SQLite query). The bug is in the 'bd dep tree --reverse' command - it incorrectly displays parent-child relationships, showing all new subtasks under wms-yun.3 regardless of their actual parent.

Database evidence:
- wms-mze depends on wms-yun.1 (correct)
- wms-q1w depends on wms-yun.2 (correct)
- wms-w3m depends on wms-0oi (correct)

But bd dep tree --reverse shows all three under wms-yun.3 (wrong).

This is a bd CLI bug, not a beads-bridge bug. The interactive visualization is working correctly - it's just displaying what bd dep tree returns.

title: Feature: POC A - Automatic bd sync + git-based change detection
description:
Implement automatic beads state synchronization and git-based change detection for simplified sync workflow.

This POC implements the approach approved by stakeholder in GH #5:
- Automatic bd sync --commit --push before reading beads data
- Git diff to detect changed epics (beads-metadata vs origin/beads-metadata)
- Parse external_ref to determine GitHub/Shortcut backend
- Sync only changed epics by default
- Add --force flag to sync all

Implementation details in: docs/plans/2025-11-16-simplified-sync-workflow.md
